intro: Arctotis crithmoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow or orange ray flowers. It typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Arctotis crithmoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
